data.meta_description:
Feb 3, 2015 - Intertitles (also known as a title card) are printed text edited into the midst of the action in a movie, generally to convey character dialogue or descriptive narrative material related to, but not necessarily covered by, the material photographed.
They were the main method of conveying dialogue and/or narration to make the story more understandable. . See more ideas about title card, silent movie, descriptive.
